altername_name: World Cup France '98: Road to Win
name: World Cup '98 France: Road to Win
overview: World Cup '98 France: Road to Win (ワールドカップ ’９８フランス ～Ｒｏａｄ ｔｏ Ｗｉｎ～), not to be confused with FIFA Road to World Cup 98 is a football game released for the Sega Saturn. World Cup '98 France recycles its core engine and much of its content from earlier Sega-published football games, particularly Sega Worldwide Soccer 98. The primary difference is that this one is a licensed product, being endorsed by both the Japan Football Association and FIFA, therefore allowing real teams and players. This is the last Saturn football game whose lineage can be traced back to 1995's Victory Goal. The next game in the series, Sega Worldwide Soccer 2000 was built from the ground-up by Silicon Dreams for the Dreamcast.
